Name: unseen sunscreen spf 40
comments:
* I have both the untinted and tinted Glow Screen (Golden Hour). I was using Aveeno Lotion w SPF for my full body, but on my face, it was leaving whiteheads. I started to test other sunscreens, including mineralized, and few seemed to work well on my face. I started with the Glow Screen first, and not only does it leave a pretty and sheer glow worn alone or under makeup, but it blended in so nicely with my skin tone. That said, I only wear it on certain parts of my face (where you'd get natural highlights), and I've opted for the untinted version for all other parts. Feels good, weightless, no whiteheads. BF said I had a nice "glow." My dermatologist also recommended it for my skin type (as well as Black Girl Sunscreen). A win all around. * I love the sunscreen so much and have been using it for many many years. It looks flawless underneath make up and it doesn't leave a greasy texture on the skin at all. I recommend this for any skin type as it just looks so good on everyone, and this is my favorite sunscreen of all time. offered by supergoop * I loved it * Pros: Wonderful texture, truly invisible on my dark brown skin. 

Cons: That price tho. * I love this product. It feels like I'm putting nothing onto my face, yet still getting the needed coverage, which is the only way I want to feel about sunscreen and makeup; natural. 

The only downside to this product is that it notes a necessary re-application every 40 minutes if swimming or sweating. The swimming part I don't care about, but I'm an oily gal in the summertime. That's a lot of re-applicating, especially considering the amount you're getting for the price. Just some food for thought. * Love using this sunscreen * I repurchased this sunscreen when it was part of Ulta's Beauty Steals. I love this sunscreen as it's easy to wear, doesn't leave a white cast on my skin, and doesn't cause breakouts. I gave it four stars because at the regular price, I would try to find a cheaper alternative.

Also if you like the gel oily feeling this would be the best spf that is in the market. I would give it a shot and see how feel about it. What I love most is how it leaves my skin looking and feeling. It gives me that healthy, radiant glow, and I appreciate knowing that I'm protected with SPF 30. This sunscreen has earned a definite spot in my favorite summer essentials shelf and will be traveling with me in my beach bag!

comments:
* I tried this product to reapply sunscreen over makeup. It worked well with makeup but it is super oily and would require blotting after applying. I used this two days in a row and each time it burned my eyes. I had my eyes closed and waited to reopen my eyes but it still burned. Wouldn't recommend * This thing smells SO TERRIBLE it gave me a headache. Had to wash it off and re-do my entire skincare & makeup. I thought this would be a nice option to top up on SPF but it's got such a strong horrendous chemical smell I don't think I can survive even using this on my body. I typically love scented products and use plenty of Dior, Chanel, Gucci makeup that's known to have strong fragrances so it's not even that I'm sensitive to scented products. Stay away. As I found out after purchasing, spray SPF isn't effective anyway (you need 45+ sprays to actually get the protection advertised). * This SPF mist by Vacation combines sun protection with a nostalgic, beachy feel in the classic retro packaging. The nozzle is designed for a fine, even mist, which makes applying it quick and mess-free. This lightweight mist feels comfortable, cooling, and non-greasy, so it's easy to work into your daily routine without leaving a sticky finish. With a subtle, beachy scent, it brings a touch of summer without being overwhelming. The formula includes hydrating ingredients, avoiding the dryness that some SPF sprays can cause, and the SPF 50 provides solid broad-spectrum coverage for everything from everyday use to extended outdoor time. The mist's finish is soft, adding a gentle glow that keeps skin looking fresh but not shiny. I haven't noticed any spills in my beach bag which is great! * As a 59-year-old self-employed Uber/Lyft driver with a love for skincare and makeup, finding an SPF that fits into my busy routine is essential. The VacationÂ® SPF 50 Super Spritz Face Mist has been a game-changer for me. It provides excellent sun protection while keeping my skin hydrated and refreshed throughout the day. I love how lightweight and non-greasy it feels, and it works perfectly over makeup, which is a huge plus for me. The blend of cucumber, aloe, and caffeine soothes and de-puffs my skin, making it look and feel calm even after long hours on the road. The luxurious, fine mist spray and its subtle tropical scent make reapplying an enjoyable experience. It's become a must-have in my skincare routine, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for convenient sun protection with added skincare benefits.

**This review was collected as part of a promotion. * I was super excited to try this vacation 50 SPF face mist. I love that it is mist and that the mist comes out super light and evenly disperses on my face. I am able to use this on the go, as the bottle is super compactible and easy to travel with. I also love that I can use it over makeup, so it doesn't smudge it or when I am not wearing any makeup. I am very fair skinned and have a history of skin cancer, so this allows me to reapply my sunscreen throughout the day. It also helps to keep the wrinkles and sun damage/hyperpigmentation at bay. It also has a very nice scent. It is not too strong and is pleasant without being overpowering. I am excited to continue using this product and am excited to try some of their other products going forward. * idea around it. It's meant so be used for your face for even coverage, but the mist left some of my face feeling unprotected. It was a nice cooling mist and helped cool me down before applying my makeup hah Overall it's a good product, but I would recommend trying to rub it around before it dries to get more even coverage. * I have been waiting a long time for a product like this. It makes applying sunblock so easy and simple. I've been hearing it for years how important it is to use SPF. Especially in skin care. I haven't started doing that until this last couple of years though. Normally in my experience, products that have SPF in it make my skin feel oily or I get a white cast look going on. Sometimes it will be a whole separate product of its own and an extra step in my regimen that sometimes I feel like I don't have time for. This is literally perfect! It has a very light scent kind of like coconut maybe. It is soothing on my skin and the way the mist comes out is perfect. Not too much product, not too heavy, and really easy to use. It is a perfect size. I usually have it right there in my purse so I can reach for it if you need to reapply. I assume it works because I haven't been sunburned being outside for long periods of time. I even use it on my kids! This is a game changer for sunscreen. You can't even tell you're wearing it!

Name: anthelios melt-in milk body and face sunscreen spf 60
comments:
* I received a sample of this from Ulta & it has been a game changer!!! It melts on my skin right away, it does have some type of white pigmentation, but I just massage it in my skin really well & problem solved. It def helps with the sun, my skin feels refreshed & protected at the same time. My friends, family & co-workers at work have seen the difference when I wear it. They tell me my face glows even from far away! This has been so far, the best sunscreen I've been wearing lately & I'm about to buy the actual size to have for myself bc I used all 3 samples LOL that's how good it is!!! * It the best , i never use sunscreen before but this one is the best, melt on the skin ðŸ‘Œ * It leaves a little bit of white cast on blank skin * I like this product, it's my first time using it. It does melt into the skin but I catch my skin or the lotion peeling some after a few hours. * This is not a matte product so if you want zero shine you need to seek out a silicone based sunscreen. 

No stinging at all, no burning. No uncomfortable textures. Not too thick, not too thin.

Personally, I have dry skin and this helped a lot. My skin felt moisturized and retained moisture better after a couple of uses. 

Just like other moisturising sunscreen products, if you are gonna wear this under makeup you need to let it absorb for probably about an hour if you want it to play well, and you'll need to make sure you are using products that work well together (ex. not silicone based primer). 

I used this on just my face for about 6 months and then alternated it with another sunscreen seasonally, it lasted me about a year and a half. 

Love it, Highly recommend. * It work well without any moisturizer but if i use moisturizer before it, it peels on my face. * it shouldn't have made me break out so bad. Pukesgiving!

Name: suntouchable whoa glow broad spectrum spf 30 sunscreen
comments:
* it made me look glowy. like way to glowy! i almost look like i had finished running a marathon and was sweating like a ton! not to mention their was lots of little glitter. not just any glitter. glitter that is hard to come off! not for me don't recommend. * It works really well for my skin and I love how glowy it makes me look. * I would go for the Halo Glow hughlighter/primer product this has. 

This SPF has flakes of glitter in it and while they may be small, they are still obvious and noticable.  I really wanted to like thisâ€¦ definitely not a supergoop dupe! * I was not a fan of this product. It's way too glowy for my preferences. I looked like the tin man. It was also really thick so I always felt it when I wore it.  I tried to use it up and I just couldn't make myself do it. If you like glowy, then this is for you. If you want a sheer glow, I wouldn't recommend it. * I use this product everyday and it is the perfect glowy base. It is meant to be more of a primer but I use it more as a foundation. It gives me a perfectly sheer and glowy finish while being a great base for my other makeup. * i can never wear this sunscreen without it pilling off my face, and creasing. do not buy. DO NOT SAVE YOUR MONEY. * I rate this product a three star because don't get me wrong. It's a good product, but I don't like how so much is shimmer and it makes my face peel. I feel like elf should make a sunscreen that tinted but not with shimmer and that doesn't peel. But it is a good product.

Or its just too many oils. * Goes on like silk and absorbs quickly. * This is a unique sunscreen. It slides onto my skin without an oily feel and immediately disappears like water. Name: sun on the run sunscreen travel kit
comments: * Wanted to try the roll on stick, its not great though. Its very oily and never dried down, not great for on the go and would stain your clothes. It does have glitter in it which i thought was cute and fun, didnt bother me since i wanted this for a disney trip to be fun anyways. The serum is fantastic, i ended up returning this set snd buying that full size. It doesn't give any shimmer which is misleading since it looks shimmery in the bottle. But it protects well, high spf, dries down quickly and felt moisturizing. * Literally the most amazing sunscreen ever! Your skin feels smooth and not greasy. * bought this to test the products instead of buying the full sizes separately. I dont find the sun shield body glow to give much of a glowy look. the stick does give off some shimmer/glitter. also I've found these products dont really settle in my skin and makes me sweat more. I do wish this kit came in the darker shades * I feel like I got a really great deal because I got the full size stick, which I love!  It took a couple of swipes but love how portable this stick is and the glow.  I always wanted to try their other sun products so I'm happy I got a chance to * Love the options in this kit! it's perfect for the summer. All the ingredients are clean and moisturizing, but not sticky. * My bumps on my chest came overnight . Theyre not normal, it will take MONTHS to get rid of these hard crators ! :( * Both of the face products apply wonderfully and work well under makeup. I have been looking for sunscreen with glitter and the stick gives a subtle sparkle without looking like you got attacked by a child's craft project. The price is also great - you get enough product to try before you decide if you want a full size.

Name: hello sunshine invisible sunscreen for face spf 50
comments: * Please don't ever discontinue this!! * I was looking at this product to replace Unseen Suncreen, which has been my go to sunscreen for the past three years. This product is still a good sunscreen, but I would not personally lay it under make up because it is thicker and more oily than unseen sunscreen. * Hands down my favorite sunscreen. I'm someone who wear makeup (a lot of makeup) everyday and this sunscreen makes your skin feel glowy and hydrated. It truly turns invisible and is the perfect primer for makeup. I think a huge reason I wear it everyday is because it's perfect for under makeup. There's good reviews for a reason, go try it for yourself ðŸ˜Š * I deal with flaking skin which ruins my makeup . Name: clear sunscreen stick spf 50+
comments: * im otw to buy my next one!!! * Wouldn't buy this again. Might even return it. Feels super greasy on my skin. * I bought this sunscreen stick for me and my son. We love going to the beach and he surfs but he hated the cream sunscreen on his face and having reapply. This stick was perfect and easy to apply with zero white cast. I kept his skin protected and he didn't mind reapplying thought out the beach day. * Absolutely love this product! I wanted a clear sunscreen for my face and the product i was using was always out of stock so i bought this based on someone's review here showing how she used the stick on her shoulder and showed where she burned and didn't. It's perfect to stash in your purse, a little goes a long way, easy to apply. I will say it has a very minimal fragrance but it practically goes away as soon as you swipe it and ive had no reactions whatsoever. My new favorite! * This stick sunscreen is the best one out. I never get burned when i use this. * I travel for work and this is perfect to have on the road. Effective, no odor, smooth and non greasy * Bought this based off of the reviews here and I am so glad I did. I was looking for a sunscreen specifically for face. This was exactly what i was looking for. It's clear, not sticky, glides on smoothly, conveniently sized. I need something to quickly put on before running out the door and this makes it easy to apply all over the face and neck area. I havent used this under makeuo yet but i am sure it wouldnt be an issue since there is no residue it leaves on the skin, it is truly smooth and feels like nothing is on. The only possible con for some might be that there is a slight fragrance. It is a VERY subtle fragrance, it reminds me of Softsoap handsoap, but it does not linger by any means. It's more like once you apply it its there but vanishes within a min maybe less? It didnt cause any irritation whatsoever.

Name: sheer mineral sunscreen spf 30
comments: * first of all this pilled on my skin and just generally felt nasty, then it gave me a pretty severe rash above my eyes/below my eyebrows. redness, flaky and burning, it hurts to put anything else on the area... * White cast * Worst product ive ever put on my skin. I love good molecules so i had high hopes for this sunscreen but literally the first day i tried it out it irritated tf out of my skin leaving it red and itchy. -10/10 would recommend. * This product contains a chemical in it that causes allergic reactions . This chemical is a known irritant and is one of the worse chemicals that is even banned in the UK . The chemical is called "butyloctyl salicylate" which is not considered an active ingredient. Many big companies in the beauty industry put that in spf to make the spf stronger. This chemical is not FDA approved. * When I realized that chemical sunscreens irritate my skin (yes, even the Korean ones), I was on the hunt for a mineral one that felt comfortable and didn't leave a terrible white cast. This one is great and has helped me prevent hyperpigmentation. * I started using this a few weeks ago and it holds up pretty well on my face. Doesnt leave a cast or make my skin oily. However it made my neck breakout into a full blown rash. Itchy and painful at times * I should have read reviews before purchasing...used it once & had horrible itching on my eyelids & chin

Name: classic body organic sunscreen spray spf 50

* This sunscreen is fantastic! Love the guava mango scent! I used this while paddle boarding on the lake in my bikini all day in 100Â° temps. I reapplied once mid day and no sunburn! We were super confused when very shortly afterwards, we were BURNED!! This wasn't the most intense sun either. Name: anthelios ultra light sunscreen lotion spray spf 60

Name: sunscreen spray spf 70
shake shake spf 50 mineral milk face sunscreen
comments: * I tried to like this product, especially with SPF 50, but I was not a fan at all. Initially with application, I did not have issues, but as I wore the product it burned and stung my eyes. Another note, the product has an extremely strong scent, which I could not tolerate smelling on my face all day long. * Very impressed with how thin this is for a mineral sunscreen, left virtually no white cast (I am a very pale person to begin with so just keep that in mind), my skin looked very glowy and it wore well under makeup. Will definitely repurchase!! * At first I disliked this product, then I realized you really need to shake the bottle for it to be a better consistency. I normally dont have an adversion to fragranced products, i even prefer them sometimes, but this is wayyyy too intense. * this sunscreen is okay, but it tends to dry my skin out and the smell is horrible. the packaging and consistency is is good! * Lightweight, absorbs quickly, and doesnt break out my sensitive, acne probe skin. Name: triple prep weightless multitasking moisturizer spf 40 face sunscreen
comments: * I was super excited to use this moisturizer as it had SPF in it. But I am utterly disappointed. It caused severe eye irritation that i had to go see an ophthalmologist. Definitely returning. * For some reason, every other facial sunscreen I've tried either made my face red and hot, had a sticky texture, or made my skin bumpy and textured afterwards. Name: daily essentials spf starter kit
comments:
* It is a great way to try a product but honestly not for everyone. I have combination skin and found myself disliking the sticky, heavy feeling. * The setting mist bottle does not spray. It is 30 minutes to my nearest Ulta store to return. Frustrating purchase! * I live on an island and absolutely don't leave the house without sunscreen, but I've never found a product that I loved for my face until now. I have combination skin and Unseen Sunscreen has become my new daily. It is smooth as silk and feels identical to Smashbox primer, if you've tried that. It absorbs almost immediately but leaves my skin soft and ready for makeup, but I think it blurs well enough that l dont need makeup (I'm in my 40's). This little sample tube has lasted me two weeks of daily use and it's finally running low. I use an amount the size of my index nail and it's enough for my face, neck, and the backs of my hands. I read some reviews questioning the SPF value, but they seemed unfounded and I wonder if those reviewers were using authentic product. 

Yesterday I went out boating for four hours and I relied only on this little kit. The Refresh spray was nice for reapplication, which I only remembered once, halfway through the day. I didn't get burned at all, even under these harshest conditions. 

The Play Everyday lotion was fine. It worked well and I definitely would have burned without it, as I missed a few spots and am absolutely fried. It just doesn't stand out above other sunblocks to me. 

Nonetheless, I'm very happy that I ordered this kit. These aren't cheap products but the quality is excellent and I don't skimp on skincare. This kit allows you to try each and see how your skin responds before investing in larger sizes. * These are so small they should be free samples. I haven't even used them yet, but I should have looked more closely at the size before ordering. The price is way too high for these tiny bottles. My skin feels amazing after using this product. I would recommend this set or even the full size of all these products. Over I would recommend this! * Cheap way to try 3 sunscreens! comments:

I like vacation brand and I think they super innovative and this product is just another example of their great brand. * I love this highlight oil! Is stays shiny for a very long time. The smell is seductive and wonderful. The highlight is amazing. I've gotten so many compliments wearing this. It is my spring/summer new favorite! I need to buy another just in case they run out of stock. All the good stuff always go fast!!!It's smells amazing and the glow is beautiful I super love itÂ I love this highlighting oil it leaves you feeling smooth and silky and smells wonderfulThis highlighting oil is perfect for summer. It makes my tan legs, arms, shoulders, and my favorite area the neck line glisten. It's lightweight, fast absorbing and not sticky. I love the peach scent. Makes me feel ready for summer.Â Compared to a competitor brand I use its very luxury in texture and presentation! * Vacation Oil
My name is Lacey, I'm a licensed cosmetologist of 18 years, and I have a serious obsession with beauty products of all kinds. Reviews are always the first place I go before buying a new product, and I'm here to share mine. As we know, SPF is the most important and most popular additive when it comes to our skincare products. Over the summer, I was lucky enough to test Vacation's shimmer oil with SPF 30, and it had me feeling and looking like a golden goddess.
Usually, applying SPF is a painful experience for me. I don't like it! Vacation took away that pain with this luxurious oil-based shimmering sunscreen. Made with coconut, jojoba, marula, and argan oils, its scent smells amazing without being too overpowering. Jojoba oil is my favorite ingredient here, and I use it often for its beneficial properties. It contains vitamin E that can do everything from boosting collagen, helping to diminish fine lines and wrinkles, while also improving your skin's elasticity and providing extra hydration. 
This product glides on your skin so silky and smoothly, without feeling super greasy or looking greasy. It spreads evenly, and a little really goes a long way. This oil feels like it actually penetrates your skin, giving you added moisturizing properties that other SPF oils do not offer.
Now the best part - the shimmer! Not too much, not too little. The tiny gold specks sparkle beautifully in the sunshine without overdoing it. I received so many compliments at the pool - noticing the shimmer and the scent. Sexiest legs ever. Overall, it's truly a beach girl's dream product.
Vacation shimmer oil makes applying sunscreen actually enjoyable. It's obvious that Vacation puts so much thought into their products to really make them stand out from the ordinary. For example, the little ball they put in the bottle to make sure that it's mixed properly before application- to evenly distribute that glittery glow. I really appreciate that little ball!
If you enjoy tanning and laying out, you need to have this product in your beach bag. Without a doubt, I'm giving Vacation Shimmer Oil a 5-star rating and I highly recommend it to all my fellow beach bums out there. 
Just get it. I'm confident you'll be thanking me when you do. There's nothing not to love about it. * My name is Jessica & I'm a 37 year old avid beauty enthusiast. The Vacation Shimmer Oil is THE LOOK of Spring & Summer & will keep you shining when the sun goes down in the Fall & Winter! The product packaging is super lux. I absolutely love the rippled cap and the fact that it's in a clear bottle which showcases you the beauty of the actual product. Both the bottle & product gives you that Bahamas vacay feeling all 4 seasons!  I like to glow all year round and this is now my holy grail. It makes my skin feel buttery soft and it gives me that perfect sparkle. It's water resistant for 80 minutes & 30SPF which to me is mind blowing after growing up in the 90s baby oil craze. It also blends seamlessly and doesn't leave a white cast like most sunscreens do. It leaves my skin with this gorgeous golden color. It smells of coconut & banana, mixed with a little pool water. The smell is absolutely divine. I mean what a dream.. vacation!! * The Vacation Shimmer Oil is THE LOOK of Spring & Summer & will keep you shining when the sun goes down in the Fall & Winter! I love how this sunscreen gives my skin a radiant, golden glow without looking overly glittery. It's subtle enough for everyday wear but still noticeable enough to make your skin look luminous and healthy in the sun.

Name: on-the-go spf duo

Name: umbra mineral cream spf 30 tinted face sunscreen
comments:
* This is the first drunk elephant product I have ever used and I purchased this myself with my own money from ulta in the shade cocoa and I'm conflicted. I do feel like, color wise, it's one of the best mineral sunscreens i have ever tried. I don't feel like it leaves a white cast and it blends pretty decently into my skin tone. You can still tell there's a little something on my face because it does look a tiny bit pale by itself, but if you put a little powder over it, it looks great. 

For reference I'm the shade nw48 in mac studio fix powder plus foundation / 21 in fenty eaze drops. 

In addition, it does not burn my skin or eyes. I wore it all day on my face, including directly on my eyelids and I did not feel any irritation on my eyes at all, which I normally feel with sunscreens. I had an itch or two on my face, but that's normal for me. The main thing I look for is burning and my skin did not feel like it was burning at all, which as someone with sensitive skin, I appreciate that. Moreover, so many products have hyaluronic acid these days, and my skin is sensitive to that, so I also appreciate that this product does not have that in it.  

The thing I don't like about this product is the texture and difficulty blending. It has a grainy texture that does not feel good at all when you are putting it on. I'm not sure how to describe it, but the closest thing I can think of is, that it kind of feels like that st. Ives scrub we used to use back in the day, only not as bad. There are no visible beads in it or anything, but it has a gritty texture when you're rubbing it in, and I'm afraid it might be too harsh in the long run. I'm not sure if it's exfoliating my skin and I'm really working on repairing my skin barrier, so I'm unsure of how i feel about this product. I was on the fence about returning it, but I think i will probably keep it to see how I fair with continued used. 

Again, I like the color (for a mineral product) and the fact that it doesn't seem to irritate my skin throughout the day, but the texture when putting it on is just so off putting that I'm unsure about it, especially since it takes quite a bit of rubbing to get that decent blend with the skin. I would say I rubbed it in for a good 5 minutes to get this color that I think looks decent, and while I was rubbing it in, it looked streaky, so at the end, I pat it into my face to finish it off. And be warned that it is pretty messy. So don't wear something white or touch any white surfaces while you're rubbing it in because you defintely need to thoroughly wash your hands and get the product off before touching anything.

Still, I would say it's worth a try because, let's be honest, the mineral options for us darker skinned girls are limited, but I'm just not sure if I would repurchase it. I think I will keep it and use it up because I do like how it looks under my mac studio fix powder plus foundation. It looks very natural with a little powder over it, but on its own, and the texture while applying it makes me feel unsure about it. * to sum it up, for a girl that likes to try new things all the time and therefore doesn't have many holy grail products, this is my holy grail sunscreen. * I notice that it has a gritty texture when applying. It also has a scent if potatoes that stays for a long time. I like the gritty feel though because it feels like I'm exfoliating my skin as I'm moisturizing it which I know sounds kind of weird. I don't know if it's worth the price at all though. * It may just be my sensitive skin, but this (or possibly another new product I used along with it) made my skin super itchy. It was unbearable and I ended up having to take my makeup off entirely with a makeup wipe. I really, really wanted to love it and was so excited to try it when I first saw it in stores, not knowing anything about it coming out. I used a lot of other Drunk Elephant products and had high hopes for this, too. But I just can't risk the chance that it will make my face unbearably itchy again, so I'm just returning both products that I think could have caused that. It did give the light, no-makeup looking coverage that I love, just like their bronzing drops. I so wish it would have worked for me :( * The sunscreen does not leave your skin oily after application. The downfall for me was that the minerals feel like sand and sunscreen mixed together. The texture of that on my skin during application is a big no for me and will be returning. * Love this! I'm fair skinned and it blends in perfectly. I just wish it was 50 spf or higher. * My face is so sensitive to face sunscreen.  I was able to put this on my face multiple times without my face getting irritated. It didn't even feel like I had sunscreen on.

Name: anthelios uv hydra sunscreen spf 50 with hyaluronic acid
comments: * This is a good product, it is totally invisible and VERY hydrating. It pairs well for me while I use tret since it is so hydrating. However, it does sit on the skin as VERY oily. But it doesnt break me out and is light, so I'm leaning towards this being a good product that I will probably rebuy. * Sunscreen works well. It's lightweight and blends easily. Plus it's not greasy which is great. My old facial sunblock would get so greasy when out and about in the sun, this one does not. * Wanted to try it and and its me new fave. * Yes, it really is invisible! I have acne prone skin and it does not break me out. This is my favorite sunscreen to date! This is the first La Roche-Posay product I've used and it's making me want to try more! * Painfully dry lips, swelling in cheeks. Never had a reaction to an SPF quite like this. * I'm not sure if its the "dewy finish" or whatever, but this sunscreen is very oily on my skin. It feels like a layer. However it is invisible which is a plus. * I tried this off and on for about a month and i love the texture of it and how it applies and it does hydrate for a little bit but after a few hours my face would be dry. The reason i had to stop using is because it caused skin redness and my skin would appear irritated.

Name: classic spray spf 30 sunscreen
comments: * I used this product as directed and religiously while out. I now look like a tomato and have sun poisoning. Don't waste your money * I used this sunscreen recently at an amusement park and it was 90s the whole time. Good news is that I didn't get burnt but I felt sticky the whole day. It was pretty uncomfortable. I would buy again if there was a dry touch option. * Unfortuately this product pilled a lot and was not sweat resitant for me. Dissappinted :( * As a ginger, sunscreen is very important to me. After using a bunch of different spf 50s on my trip, this has stayed #1! The smell is amazing, the spray is very powerful and only needs a little bit since it goes such a long way, and it leaves a nice glow without too much oil! I heavily recommend this spf! * perfect sunscreen for wandering the city, hiking, just sitting outside, not greasy which is so major, smells unique in a good way * DON'T BUY!! Does NOT work!!!! Went camping and had the family use this spf and we all ended up burnt! I take sunscreen very seriously and this the first time with any that hasn't worked! Not worth it!! * I don't know what was in this sunscreen, but I was really looking forward to a convenient spray SPF. I put it on my forearms and neck in late morning and was put off by the scent, but brushed it off. Later that night, I noticed small, red pinpricks all over my arms. I woke up the next morning and the dots had become red bumps, and were noticeable over my neck, looking similar to acne. As of now, about 36 hours later, my arms are still covered in bumps, though they are no longer red. I have no known allergies, so I don't know what caused this reaction. All this to say, I have not enjoyed this experience, and the scent is unpleasant anyways.

Name: daily spf starter set for face and body

Name: unseen sunscreen spf 40
comments:
* I have both the untinted and tinted Glow Screen (Golden Hour). I was using Aveeno Lotion w SPF for my full body, but on my face, it was leaving whiteheads. I started to test other sunscreens, including mineralized, and few seemed to work well on my face. I started with the Glow Screen first, and not only does it leave a pretty and sheer glow worn alone or under makeup, but it blended in so nicely with my skin tone. That said, I only wear it on certain parts of my face (where you'd get natural highlights), and I've opted for the untinted version for all other parts. Feels good, weightless, no whiteheads. BF said I had a nice "glow." My dermatologist also recommended it for my skin type (as well as Black Girl Sunscreen). A win all around. * I love the sunscreen so much and have been using it for many many years. It looks flawless underneath make up and it doesn't leave a greasy texture on the skin at all. I recommend this for any skin type as it just looks so good on everyone, and this is my favorite sunscreen of all time. offered by supergoop * I loved it * Pros: Wonderful texture, truly invisible on my dark brown skin. 

Cons: That price tho. * I love this product. It feels like I'm putting nothing onto my face, yet still getting the needed coverage, which is the only way I want to feel about sunscreen and makeup; natural. 

The only downside to this product is that it notes a necessary re-application every 40 minutes if swimming or sweating. The swimming part I don't care about, but I'm an oily gal in the summertime. That's a lot of re-applicating, especially considering the amount you're getting for the price. Just some food for thought. * Love using this sunscreen * I repurchased this sunscreen when it was part of Ulta's Beauty Steals. I love this sunscreen as it's easy to wear, doesn't leave a white cast on my skin, and doesn't cause breakouts. I gave it four stars because at the regular price, I would try to find a cheaper alternative.

The bottle looks to be a decent size - a little smaller than your average spray sunscreen container. The product itself worked well. There was a slight white cast but it wasn't bad. And we are relatively small people. Is this a joke?? Good thing that was all we needed for our trip, but that's DEFINITELY not worth the money. Such a bummer!

Name: self reflect probiotic moisturizing sunscreen spf 32
comments:
* I was lucky enough to get the sunscreen on sale and try it out. Otherwise it is a pretty pricey sunscreen. I was worried about trying it out because every single time I've had anything with SPF it made me break out. Idk what it is and as a reference I have super dry skin. I dont get much acne or breakouts unless my skin is unhappy with a product. Finally I found an SPF item my skin approves of. Hopefully you get a good sale on it! * I really like this sunscreen, because it's cruelty-free, gentle, & NON-water-resistant.  I have used it on my face  over cruelty-free spf30 moisturizer, my arms, & legs.  It has a pleasant vanilla smell & uses tumeric & other gentle ingredients.  I was disappointed in the expiration date, however, & returned it.  Will order another one online to hopefully get a better exp. date.  I recommend it highly! * I love this sunscreen! It is one of the only ones I've tried that doesn't break me out. I have normal, but dehydrated skin that is fairly sensitive and acne prone. The zinc oxide in this sunscreen really helps calm redness and irritation in my skin and is somewhat hydrating whereas some sunscreens I've tried for acne prone skin were too drying for me. I used this for years and decided to try other sunscreens, but I ended up coming back to this one as others i tried just didnt compare. * It leaves a dewy sheen, has a pleasant smell, and did not break me out. For me, it was just too thick feeling on my skin, so I will be returning. But, I really do get why it's popular. * I have been using this sunscreen for a while (probably almost 2 years). I do mix in a little bit of tinted sunscreen from another brand, but can wear this on its own. The best things about this sunscreen are that it wears well under makeup and it provides amazing protection. My make up lasts just as long with this underneath, and does not change the finish. Sometimes I feel like it makes it look better. 

The protection on this is phenomenal. I went to an all day concert this weekend, and used this with my holy grail foundation that lasts through almost anything and for over 15 hours. I forgot to put sunscreen on my arms for the first hour, and got a little red even though I put sunscreen on pretty early. However, my face was not burned AT ALL, and I was in the sun a lot. 

I dont usually wear this one on its own, I usually wear a more tinted one if I am not wearing makeup, but this is my favorite sunscreen under make up, hands down, and the highest % protection out of any of my other sunscreens. Highly recommend! * I have been trying so many different sunscreens and so many i havent liked. The kinship is amazing and its great for dry skin. Works well with the vitimin C serum im uaong. I will definitely repurchase * I have tried so many sunscreens for the face. A lot of them are nice, but eventually break me out. The ones that don't make my eyes water, and make me look very oily. This sunscreen looks very nice on the face. It evens out my skin tone a bit, and moisturizes. It can be a little tacky, but the finish looks so nice, I don't mind. Some days I use a light hand and dust some setting powder over top. This gives a nice glow, while letting your natural skin tone shine through. Definitely give us a try.

Name: dew good illuminating serum sunscreen with probiotic technology spf 30
comments: * I loved this product so much I repurchased another bottle. It gave my skin a soft dewy glow. The formula must have changed between purchases because I developed an incredible itch on my face and neck which included a bumpy rash. I eliminated all current products I was using and added back in slowly and much to my chagrin this was the culprit. If you have sensitive skin, beware. If you don't,  go for it! I am still disappointed I cant use it anymore. * I absolutely adore this sunscreen! I dont like to wear foundation, so this gives me the perfect dewy base without feeling trapped or heavy. * I could NOT recommend this sunscreen more. I've repurchased several times now, and I get so many compliments on my skin when I wear it. It's lightweight but moisturizing, the perfect glowy base for makeup (but also beautiful on its own!), smells luxe and divine, and has the perfect amount of SPF for everyday use. But while the product itself is incredible, I think the packaging needs work. I love the glass for sustainability reasons, but once the product starts to run low, it's incredibly hard to get the pump to work. I can visibly see that there's plenty more product in the container, but the pump won't retrieve it. Once I get to the end I have to unscrew the pump and use a tiny spatula to get the last of it out. This sunscreen is pricey, so I'm definitely trying to get my money's worth here, and the packaging makes it difficult to do so. It's not enough to stop me from buying it because I love this product so much (and I am PICKY about sunscreen), but I do hope COOLA sees this and makes a change soon. * I got a sample of this product from Ulta and had a horrible reaction to it. I got hives, my face was so swollen and red, and I was itchy. Definitely do a swab test if youre going to use this product, and give it time to react (I didn't react until about 8 hours after putting it on). * This is the second summer I've been using this sunscreen and I love it! Has protection and makes you glow. I always get compliments on my skin when I wear it * I love this product. You need very little. But, my skin looks amazing with it. * I wore this a few times without a problem but got a bad rash on my forehead today. I had no other products on my face so it had to be this. It was very hot today so maybe the product causes rash at certain temps? Name: force shield superlight sunscreen broad spectrum spf 30
comments:
* This didn't work well for me or my husband, and I've found a competing green-tint sunscreen that works well.

Generally, it looked and felt like we were wearing sunscreen with an oily white cast. I prefer a more natural look if I'm trying to reduce redness, and I will sacrifice water resistance to get it.

It didn't work for me, specifically, because I think I developed a mild allergic reaction after a day or two of wear. It's the downside of putting lots of extracts into a product. You can scrutinize the ingredients ahead of time, but it feels like I'm rolling an allergy roulette wheel for every additional extract they add. (This shouldn't matter to most people, but it might matter to those who are allergy-prone and are looking to reduce redness.)

It did appear to work as sunscreen, even if we didn't like the look of it. * Use it almost everyday , only con is cap pops off easily * I've tried so many different sunscreens both high end and drugstore and nothing compares to this one. It doesn't dry out my face, no white cast, no breakouts and is a physical sunscreen. I probably have gone through 10 tubes of this and use this daily on me and my kids. I usually stock up during an Ulta sale. Make up goes on nicely and I have not experienced pilling. If I had to improve one thing though it would to make it a higher spf, maybe to 50. I have to carry a sunscreen stick to reapply sunscreen when I'm out because this is only spf 30. * yassss * It doesn't break me out or clog my pores which is all I really care about. But to help others out... Definitely depends on your makeup and whatever other skincare products you are using, but I've personally had no issues with pilling. It feels very light and I do notice a slight redness correction whether that is because of the green tint or white cast. Yes it has a white cast but it doesn't last?! however that works. Also remember to properly wash any sunscreen off with a cleanser, I use micellar water before going in with my daily face wash. The smell reminds me of a slight playdoh scent if you're sensitive to smells. The pump is kinda hard to get product out of sometimes too but it's whatever. * I searched for months to find a spf that wouldnt cause breakouts. I have dry, acne prone skin & have recently started using retinoids, so spf is super important to wear now. Within days of using this, I broke out worse than I ever have in my life. It went on for days - each morning i would wake up to more pimples. Absolutely horrid product. * A lot of the reviews say it pills or leaves a white cast, but I dont notice that at all. I find if I let my moisturizer dry completely before sunsncreen and let the sunscreen dry completely before applying makeup there are no issues. The sunscreen is a bit if a thicker cream with a slight green tint to color correct. It also gives my skin a nice natural glow. It feels velvety on the skin and I will definitely rebuy! This is one of the better skin care focused sunscreens I have used and I love the acne benefits!

I can truly attest to the sun protection, as once I missed a spot and could see a very clear, visible pink patch with a hard line differentiating from where the protection was! I also use this on my daughter who has sensitive skin and eczema, and it seems to be going okay. 

Fragrance-free means no added frangranceâ€”so it smells like a natural sunscreen, which I don't mind. But I see some people complaining about thatâ€¦

If you're looking for excellent sun protection, especially for tattoos, I HIGHLY recommend this product! * Dries quickly and invisible on skin. Leaves a somewhat velvety texture, but feels very light and not sticky. Good amount of product for the price. I had high hopes due to positive reviews about no cast and fragrance-free (I'm very sensitive to scents). However, it has a horrible chemical-y smell, sort of like plastic? * I am loving COOLA right now. This SPF is perfect for this dreadful Texas humidity and heat. It's very lightweight, non-greasy, and has a pleasant scent. Reapplying is a breeze since the product doesn't build up on the skin or cause a film. It's very breathable and works well with general skin sensitivities. The size is quite large for travel, but still small enough to throw in your beach bag and still have space for other necessities. It has a click-locking spray top so it doesn't accidentally spray in your bag. I will say that if your skin is very dry, you may want to go for a cream SPF because this does not provide much moisture. This is definitely made for hot, sunny summers. I love it and I know for sure I am buying a full-sized bottle to keep on hand.

***This review was collected as part of a promotion.*** * As a professional in the beauty industry, I've learned firsthand the  importance of sun protection, making COOLA's  spray an indispensable asset. COOLA's sunscreen spray doesn't just shield your skin from UVA and UVB rays; Its broad-spectrum protection ensures comprehensive coverage, safeguarding against both premature aging and potential skin damage. As someone deeply invested in skin health, I love COOLA's commitment to providing a product that protects and cares for my skin.

The scent of PiÃ±a Colada fragrance is delicious. Gone are the days of sunscreen smelling like, well, sunscreen. Instead, COOLA's tropical scent transports me to my last vacation. It's a big change from the clinical smell of traditional sunscreens, making the application process a sensory experience.

I did not have any issue in my delicate skin but I always recommend  a patch test.

In my personal opinion, COOLA's in spray isn't just a sun protection product; it's an  evolution of skincare. With its comprehensive protection, anti-aging benefits, and irresistible PiÃ±a Colada scent, COOLA has redefined what it means to stay safe in the sun. This feature is particularly appealing for those who dislike the heavy feeling often associated with sunscreen application. The spray mechanism ensures effortless and even coverage, making it convenient for reapplication throughout the day, especially during outdoor activities.  In conclusion, the COOLA PiÃ±a Colada Classic Body Organic Sunscreen Spray SPF 30 offers a luxurious and effective sun protection solution for those who appreciate both quality and indulgence in their routine. * As a licensed Esthetician, we our taught early on how important using SPF to protect our skin. I know the spf is quality and better packaged and easily portable. * This review was collected as part of a promotion. My name is Michele and I'm a Beauty Expert in my early 30's with fair combination skin. As the weather gets warmer, I have to make sunscreen a priority in my skincare routine. I am absolutely loving the Coola Clear Spray Body Sunscreen SPF 30 PiÃ±a Colada Sunscreen. I love its yummy, natural PiÃ±a Colada scent. It takes me away on a vacation to my favorite beach. This is a non-aerosol sunscreen that is so easy to spray onto your skin. It has a lightweight, lighter than air, mist texture that absorbs so quickly into my skin without leaving any greasy residue. I got the chance to try the full size 6 fluid ounce version of this spray sunscreen. This sunscreen is formulated with at least 70% Organic Ingredients. You get broad spectrum SPF 30 UVA and UVB protection. This sunscreen has water resistance that lasts up to 80 minutes so you can enjoy more time in the sun and water without worrying about reapplying every hour. Safflower Oleosomes is plant derived encapsulation technology that makes this formulation even more effective. Spray this sunscreen on your skin 15 minutes before any sun exposure. Make sure to reapply this sunscreen every 80 minutes. I would recommend this to anyone of any age who loves the sun and wants to have lightweight, long lasting and fast absorbing sun protection that also keeps your skin hydrated too. * Sun care is very important because it can help prevent skin cancer. I can't stress enough how important it is to wear sunscreen everyday. I was looking for a new everyday sunscreen and I think I found it. I prefer spray sunscreen than a cream so this one is perfect. It smells absolutely amazing and I love it! With most sunscreens they can get really heavy and greasy. I was really pleased that it absorbs really well on the skin and doesn't leave a layer of oil behind. Another thing I like is the ingredients, because I was having a hard time finding sunscreens that didn't have harsh or harmful ingredients. The Coola brand has organic and vegan ingredients so no worries about having harmful chemicals being absorbed in your body. So far so good and I would repurchase it.

Name: urban environment vita-clear sunscreen spf 42
comments:

Highly recommended for its lightweight feel and skin-friendly formulation. * Goes in clear which is great fir those "no makenup days" 
Very hydrating and gives my skin a nice glow. I wear in the summer time and my face always feels protected. 
Id tou are jot into the glowy/dewey look, id recommend a diffrent product! * I really like this sunscreen! It absorbs very quickly, lightweight, and help controls my oil production throughout the day. I still have to blot my face in the afternoon, but it helps. I also like to use a water base moisturizer underneath :) 
PLEASE NOTE* a little goes A LONG WAY! 
Your face will be a grease pit if you put too much on, learned the hard way. * I dont get why some people love the "dewey" effect because at least on me, when I put this sunscreen on, it felt like I just spent the day frying stuff in the kitchen and all sweaty, right after my shower! It's greasy, doesn't absorb well, and it stings the eyes terribly like a poorly-formulated budget buy. I really dislike it and will be returning it.

it's spf30, so it's efficacy is 2 hours - so reapply.   I highly recommend this for a mineral sunscreen. * It's lightweight and easy to wear but I dont feel like it protects me enough from the sun. It has a slight tint that when applied it's hardly noticeable but sunscreen seems a little drying but not as much as some other tinted sunscreens that I"ve tried. Would buy this again. * I find this sunscreen perfect for sitting under makeup or wearing it alone. * This sunscreen has Butyloctyl Salicylate, a cousin to octisalate, and a chemical UV absorber. That's how they can get a higher SPF with such a low concentration of Zinc or TO. So it isn't purely mineral. I like it and use it, but I wish they wouldn't market it as 100% mineral when it has unregulated chemical UV absorbers in it.

Name: sheer mineral sunscreen lotion for face spf 50+
comments: * Although it's a sheer mineral sunscreen, I found that it's still difficult to completely rub into the skin and leaves a white cast (like most mineral sunscreens). I really wanted to like this brand as I've also tried their other sunscreens but they're just not for me. * I agree with many other reviewers about the product's comfort on the skin, easy to rub in formula, and ease of washing off compared to other mineral sunscreens. I switched to this from the CeraVe facial moisturizing lotion with SPF for a higher coverage and mineral. After about a month, my entire face was broken out, from my forehead line, temples, cheeks, chin, and jaw, all red under the skin bumps that were super itchy. Even though it's an otherwise clean product, make sure to spot test this a few times before buying! * I really wanted to like this sunscreen, especially because of the protection from blue light. However, this product isn't for me. It takes quite a while to rub in, and a white cast is still inevitable. It also feels greasy after a few hours of wear. I wish Ulta would restock the Jack Black sunscreen I have come to love over the years! * I tried the blue lizzard Sheer Mineral Sunscreen Lotion for Face SPF 50+ and I was very impressed. It is very lightweight and goes on sheer. I have very dry skin and most mineral sunscreens leave my skin uncomfortably dry after 2 hours. This is not the case with the blue lizzard sunscreen. I am able to wear it and reaply without my skin feeling uncomfortable. This is a great product for the price. * When applying the proper amount, it does leave a white cast on brown skin. But feels great on skin * I was recommended by a dermalogist to use blue lizard. I have dark brown spots.I have been using this product for over 6 years. I have noticed a difference on my face. * I've heard nothing but good things about this brand and when I ran out of my current face sunscreen, I decided to try this one. I love that it's an SPF50. That's honestly the only positive thing I can say about this sunscreen. It comes out pretty runny, but it's the consistency of Elmer's Glue and I imagine that this is exactly what it would feel like if you tried to rub glue into your face. On top of being difficult to apply, it leaves a horrible white cast. This one was a miss for me.

Name: daily 50 face gel
comments: * I really like this formula. Reminds me of Supergoop but less silicone-y and my skin felt like it breathed more. My issue was the scent. I am normally not sensitive to smells but this smelled like something spoiled and it didnt go away quickly. Like burning rubber and cat puke. Surprised more reviews havent commented on it. * this sunscreen basically acts like a silcone primer that smoothes and fills in prores while having a gripping affect. your skin just feels so immaculate thats the only word to describe it. i would moisturize your skin thoroughly and wait 5 minutes to let it absorb then wait at least 5 minutes before putting on any kind of makeup, you wont be disappointed. * This daily SPF gel is lightweight, glides on easily and doesn't give your face the typical white sunscreen cast.  It comes out of the bottle a little watery and then feels like silk as your rubbing it into your skin.  I love that this has a high SPF than most facial sunscreens. * If you've ever tried the Supergoop invisible sunscreen, this is practically the same thing for HALF the cost! Though highly raved about, I personally never enjoyed the Supergoop formula because the heavy silicone texture was off-putting and did nothing for my dry skin. It just felt like I was wearing a slippery silicone mask all day. I prefer dewy SPF lotions for this reason. They provide hydration and protection all in one. However, I love Sun Bum sunscreens so I still wanted to give this a try! The term "gel" is slightly misleading because it makes you think of a cooling gel consistency which this is not. This is definitely that same silicone texture, but the formula has a more hydrating quality to it. The silicone base gives it a mattifying texture which makes it invisible on the skin. The more exciting part: this is weightless and DOES NOT BURN THE EYES! I have yet to find a single U.S. chemical sunscreen that doesn't burn my eyes into oblivion. I don't know how this formula would hold up on the beach or under extreme sweating/activity, but I fully recommend (as it's advertised) for daily wear or under makeup. Sun Bum is killing it! * This is hands down the best-looking sunscreen I've ever tried.  Unlike other gel sunscreens, this one doesn't pill. * This contains coconut oil as one of the first ingredients.  If you are easily acne prone and/or prone to clogged pores stay away.  Coconut oil is HIGHLY comedogenic.  It would be nice if they created a facial sunscreen that is noncomedogenic. * I used sunscreen everyday. Feels good under makeup! It almost has a matte feeling - sorta like a primer. Definitely not the average face sun CREAM. Gel is in the name, gel is exactly the consistency! I would buy again!

It's likely only noticeable to me, but that's my only complaint. If you're better at setting your undereyes than I am, this will probably check all of your boxes. I've definitely found my go-to sunscreen. * I have searched high and low for a high spf that ALWAYS pairs well with other skincare products and/or with makeup without pilling. This does the perfect job. I wear it alone or it is a perfect base before makeup. I've repurchaed it 3 times and will continue to do so. * I like this but it's too greasy. I also use Bliss Blockstar which I love but the color is too dark for my fair skin and leaves it with a weird "pink-orange" cast & the SPF isn't as high. I found this because my skin is sun sensitive/heat reactive and mineral sunscreen is far superior for me. Greasy blobs came out the first time I used it and afterward it made my skin feel greasy. I also don't like the Vitamin C but only because my skin is acid sensitive. So get rid of the excess grease and Vitamin C and it's a keeper! * I bought a tinted sunscreen and have loved it from the very first day of use. I am thrilled to have found a tinted sunscreen that is gentle on my rosacea, doesn't sting the eyes, and absorbs well without leaving my face greasy. The finish it leaves on the skin is beautiful, providing a lovely, satin-like glow. It works exceptionally well even in the summer heat. I've tried several sunscreens before, but this one stands out for its comfort and effectiveness. Definitely the best one I've tried so far! * my go to tinted face sunscreen. very light coverage but blends with many skin tones. always has protected my skin and has never broken me out * I have sensitive skin with rosacea and this is doesn't bother my skin.  The tint is just a hint if color for me (I'm light to med complextion).  I look glowy and dewy.  Its great when don't want to wear foundation.  Mineral sunscreen is so hard to find without the white cast.  This has none of it.  It's definatelu worth a try.  This is my go to sunscreen from now on.

Name: correct & protect broad spectrum spf 45| pa++++
comments:
* This serum has good healthy ingredients but the mineral sunblock that is in it ruins the whole serum. The serum will not melt into your skin. Then if you put makeup on over it, the makeup will not apply evenly and the makeup sits on top of your pores and fine lines and accentuates them! This serum also was not as greaseless as I had hoped. It was a little greasy. So I don't recommend this serum at all. The sunblock in it is 17% Zinc Oxide. That is most likely the reason it never melts into your skin. The price is also very expensive. * It blends into the skin without any white cast but I feel it doesn't get absorbed easily, feels greasy and uncomfirtable on my skin. I can't get past the fact that it feels tacky on the skin for such a long time. For the price point, I'm sure there are much better product out there . * sensitive enough on eczema prone skin during the summer time! * Had high hopes but, after using the full bottle, I did not see any "Correct"ing benefit. BThey should take this word out of the name, it is misleading.  Also it smells a bit unpleasant which mostly dissipates.
It did give me sun protection but I can get that from a much less expensive product.
Overall a disappointment. * I am a very tan latina who has gone through tons of sunscreen trying to find one with no white cast that actually gives protection. While the price point is steep, it is 100% worth it. You can't go wrong with any of Murad's sunscreens. Love this more than the hydrating purple one because that one smells awful! * Product causes white casting. * This is the first sunscreen I have used that is in the texture of a serum. I like that because it has the consistency of a serum it is not very thick and applies easily. I didn't think this felt greasy but I have used many mineral sunscreens and am used to the way they wear. If you are not you may not like the way it feels on the skin. I felt this product absorbed well and didn't just sit on top of my skin.

Name: vegan collagen every day lotion spf 30
comments:
* I love this brand and I was excited to find a daily moisturizer from them with spf and even went through several bottles but I had to stop using it because it caused my eyes to burn and water profusely. I would also add that it has a very oily finish, so if you have oily or combo skin, this likely isn't for you. * I've used this through a couple of bottles. My skin takes time to adjust to products (hence why the couple of bottles). 

I love that it is cruelty free and has vegan collagen. I love that it has SPF 30, a must for me, BUT it smells like sunscreen. It is definitely moisturizing, I don't have an issue with dry skin, BUT it's rather greasy. My daughter has even commented that my face is really greasy when I wear it (not really the vibe I'm going for). The chemicals burn my eyes as the day goes on. If I even wipe my eyes, it takes me minutes to wipe away whatever traces of this moisturizer is around my eyes. If I regularly wore makeup, this would be extra problematic. If you wear contacts, I do not recommend this. Imagine that burning getting caught up under your contacts.

I really, really wanted to love this because I didn't want to go through having my skin adjust to a new product, but I can't justify it based on it being a habit. * As mentioned by others, this would be more accurately described as "SPF 30 sunscreen with collagen." Smells exactly like a normal drugstore sunscreen. It's light and doesn't feel too greasy (but there is still a bit of that feeling). Overall it's ok * Just finished my bottle and ordered another one.  I have sensitive, adult cystic acne, 44 yr old skin that is in the normal to dry stage. This product:
1) has a sunscreen like feel to it when you first apply it, then it fades away
2) has a great glass bottle that you can get ALL of the product out of!
3) Spreads well- at little goes a long way- to much will make it sticky and it won't dry down fast
4) plays well with Good Molecules Hyaluronic acid serum and PUR love your selfie foundation. * I'm getting older, and my skin is changing, and I hate it. My old favorite daily moisturizer/SPF by No. 7 started making me breakout after years of no problems, so I had to search for something new. All the others I tried that claimed to not clog pores also happened to be too drying for my slightly oily but aging but still acne prone and also kinda dehydrated skin (ugh). But the moisture level of this Goldilocks cream is just right. If you have dry or slightly dry skin you will probably like it, if you are 40+ you will probably like it, if you're young and have oily skin you might NOT like it because it is not a light liquid, it's definitely a thick-ish cream. I can tell the fragrance they were trying for was *floral* but it leans more chemical, although it disappears in a minute or two. After application the skin feels moist, but not greasy. Makeup applies perfectly over it with no pilling at all. I somehow manage to not look shiny over the course of the day, which is practically miraculous. It doesn't seem to make me break out, as I've been using it for several weeks with no notable flares. I am relieved to have found my new favorite! * i like how this spf does not leave a white cast like other spfs. Plumped my skin right up and gave it a nice silky glow. * Love the fact its a moisturizer and has spf. Its easy to use and dont need as much since it spreads easily on your skin. I can feel it last for a good amount of time too

Name: refreshing water plumping gel serum sunscreen spf 30
comments:
* I did not expect much from this sunscreen at all, honestly. I usually stick with Asian sunscreens as they have exceptionally elegant lightweight formulas with filters far more advanced than those you can find in the US. I got a sample of this, however, and was genuinely surprised by the formula and how it felt on the skin. For reference, I have oily-combination skin, so a light SPF is a must. This sunscreen definitely fit its description of a gel serum- I would say that's definitely how it felt going on (maybe a tad bit more of a gel cream, but still quite light, regardless), and in my experience, it sinks in quite quickly while still leaving the skin feeling the skin hydrated and moisturized. I don't typically use moisturizer when I use this, but that's just what works for my skin personally. I have very sensitive eyes and this also did not sting my eyes at all when applied around my eye area, which is a huge plus for me as that can turn me off from a sunscreen completely. Different things work differently for everyone so I would still recommend getting a sample and trying before spending this much on a sunscreen, especially as there are lots of incredible SPFs that are MUCH more affordable, but finding a sunscreen thats actually enjoyable to use can be extremely hard so I definitely appreciate finding one (a US sunscreen, at that) that feels this nice and would absolutely recommend.
